sentences: Douglas Lee Miller (December 31, 1949 â€“ February 5, 2021) was an American gospel musician.
He started his music career, in 1984, with the release of, I Still Love the Name Jesus, that was released by Atlanta International Records.
Miller was born on December 31, 1949 in Johnstown, Pennsylvania as Douglas Lee Miller, and was reared in the church singing in the choir.
He went to the University of Akron, and while there at the college, Mattie Moss Clark trained him how to hone his craft, and presented him at Midnight Musicals put on by The Church of God in Christ.
